page.title: 09KEEPING WELL IN GLENLUCE
page.content: All houses have electricity and a high proportion of people burn coal and wood on open fires to keep{warm.} Since the miners'strike in 1984/85 a lorry calls weekly with bags of peat and half the families in the area buy peat for their fires.Calor gas is used in about a quarter of the houses, but only a few people burn oil as it is now very expensive.{Health}in Glenluce is cared for by Dr Baird, helped by an assistant. They have an appointments system with a morning and late afternoon surgery. A schools'{dental service parks a mobile clinic for treatment at the school once a year. At other times people go to Stranraer. There is an Old Folks Welfare Committee looking after the needs of the{elderly. }The nearest{hospital}is 10 miles away in Stranraer or 65 miles to Dumfries for major operations.
